channel.title: Grand Theft Auto games appreciation thread.
channel.description:
This is a thread for it. To remember how much this series is awesome.
Because they were sandboxes; You could do what you want, where you want, how you want. They say you should take a shotgun and a car to go take down a dealer from another gang or something, why not take a fuckin' chopper, do a couple of stuns then go blew the motherfucker with a rocket launcher and a flamethrower?
Because of they had very good stories; You really felt (at least I did) attached to the characters, you believed in them. I was shocked when I had to kill Luigi in GTA III, or when you saw Ryder and Big Smoke tradin' with Tenpenny in GTA San Andreas. There was a lots of action, suspense, everything a good game, or even a movie needs! I don't know who is the writer for the series, but if he ever writes a movie in the style of GTA III or IV, I will make him passionate sex.
Because of its simplicity; you only had to take the controller and you could do whatever you want. Drive a car, a boat, an hellicopter, a tank, an ATV, a plane, a dodo, E-V-E-R-Y-T-H-I-N-G without even looking in the Control Options. Even if you never had a controller in your hands before, 10 minutes latter you we're stealin' Mercedes and Cessnas.
Unfortunately I only ever played to GTA III, Vice City and San Andreas and a bit of the IV which was far too heavy for my comp, but I only own GTA III for the PS2. The others are pirated copies for PC. I will probably get VC/LC stories, as well a VC/SA for the PS2 off ebay if I get the job.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto games appreciation thread.
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Wasabi:

I was once being chased by the police whilst I did my best to escape them on a bike. I drove up an off-ramp, dodging between the oncoming traffic, when I noticed a police car heading towards me at full speed. I did my best to swerve away but he caught the back of the bike and I flew over the road and landed on the side of another car’s bonnet. I breathed a sigh of relief and began to stand up, preparing my epic getaway where I planned to leap off the overpass into the sea below. Unfortunately a police car span out and crushed me directly between the two cars.

It was epic.

I was that police car.

Read full topic

I did my best to swerve away but he caught the back of the bike and I flew over the road and landed on the side of another car’s bonnet. CTID:

I actually didn’t know there were mods for the PC GTA games.

https://www.gtagarage.com/mods/index.php

^ They’re my favourite sites, there are also alot of foreign sites but I normally can’t find my way around them

Should help you on how to install them as well.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto games appreciation thread.
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
CTID:

That’s because they made driving in GTA 4 a lot more realistic. I prefer it, really. It’s really nice once you get used to it.

Probably because you got half decent frame rates. It’s definitely fun, but harder.
It’s hard to tell how fast you’re going with bad framerates, so I usually end up drifting into a wall.

PS, best kill ever was when I was drifting, there was a guy standing next to the wall, and the side of my car smashed straight into him.

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto games appreciation thread.
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
For once I actually agree with iKy.

Level:

Also, driving in San Andreas is so much easier then GTA 4. When I switched over, I tried to drift around a corner, ran into 3 pedestrians and smoked a wall.

That’s because they made driving in GTA 4 a lot more realistic. I prefer it, really. It’s really nice once you get used to it.
